metadata.title: CVE-2020-17376 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Guest.migrate in virt/libvirt/guest.py inOpenStack Nova before 19.3.1, 20.x before 20.3.1, and 21.0.0. By performinga soft reboot of an instance that has previously undergone live migration,a user may gain access to destination host devices that share the samepaths as host devices previously referenced by the virtual machine on thesource host. This can include block devices that map to different Cindervolumes at the destination than at the source. Only deployments allowinghost-based connections (for instance, root and ephemeral devices) areaffected.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-17376` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nova-ajax-console-proxy - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-api - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-api-metadata - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-api-os-compute - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-api-os-volume - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-cells - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-common - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-compute - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-ironic - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-kvm - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-libvirt - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-lxc - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-qemu - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-vmware - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-xen - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-conductor - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-novncproxy - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-scheduler - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-serialproxy - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-spiceproxy - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
nova-volume - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
python3-nova - 3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nova package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3:23.0.0-0ubuntu1').
